steps.action: Press “Win + E” keys, open File Explorer, go to the folder where “cmdextension.msi” locates,cmdextension.msi locates in C:\VMShare
In file explorer, click on “File -> Open Windows PowerShell -> Open Windows PowerShell as administrator”

steps.expected:
The prompt window should pop up: Title is “Microsoft Cloud Manage Desktop Extension”, and Message is “Microsoft Cloud Managed Desktop Extension Setup completed successfully.”

If the step failed, run: msiexec /i cmdextension.msi /qn+ /l*v mylog. Send mylog to CMD Agent team for troubleshooting

steps.action: Open “Control Panel -> Programs -> Uninstall a program”
steps.expected: Verify “Microsoft Cloud Managed Desktop Extension” is present in the list of installed programs.

steps.action: Press “Win + R” keys, type “services.msc” and press Check agent installationnter.
steps.expected: Verify “Microsoft Cloud Managed Desktop Extension” - Status is “Running”, Startup Type is “Automatic (Delayed Start)”, and Log On As is “Local System”.

steps.action: Press “Win + R” keys, type “taskschd.msc” and press Enter. Open “Task scheduler library -> Microsoft -> CMD”
steps.expected: Verify “Cloud Managed Desktop Extension Health Evaluation” is present.

steps.action: Press “Win + R” keys, type “wbemtest” and press Enter. Click on “Connect”, type “root\cmd\clientagent” and press Enter.
steps.expected: Verify there is NOT error prompt window which displays “Invalid namespace”.
